--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "chhofchhof" <Christian.Hofmann@...> wrote:
=

> Do you know tricks to handle that amount of data?

Hi!

Dunno how your s=
etup is, but if you plan to activate each organism only few times per gener=
ation I guess you could try the neat code from eco.

I've put a patch to th=
e v0.7 release, called huge.patch.gz, in the eco folder. Beware though, it =
uses s**tload of memory (around 700Mb) for a population of 25 organisms and=
 3001 inputs (bias is the first) & 150 outputs. It takes around 15 minutes =
on a 2 GHZ computer to run 100 generations. Run the test program and choose=
 the HUGE test.

Patch v0.7 and grab neat.c neat.h error.h and include them=
 in your project. Have a look at test.c to see how to use. Note that only F=
eed Forward networks are possible to evolve after patching, due to my lazin=
ess for the moment :)

/Magnus
